title: next
description: The `next` object in Pure Data determines if an incoming message belongs to the same "logical event" as the preceding message. It outputs a bang from its left outlet if the message is a new event (e.g., a single mouse click or a delayed bang), and from its right outlet if it's part of the same event stream (e.g., multiple bangs from `uzi`). This is useful for triggering actions once per distinct event or message dump.
